quiz.title: Technical Reasoning Beginner to Intermediate Quiz

questions.text: What is the primary function of a CPU in a computer?
questions.explanation: The CPU (Central Processing Unit) executes instructions by performing fetch, decode, and execute cycles, acting as the computer's 'brain'.

questions.text: Which of the following is a volatile memory?
questions.explanation: RAM (Random Access Memory) is volatile, meaning it loses its data when power is turned off, unlike non-volatile storage like ROM or hard disks.

questions.text: What does HTTP stand for in web technology?
questions.explanation: HTTP (HyperText Transfer Protocol) is the protocol used for transferring web pages and data over the internet.

questions.text: Which programming language is known for its use in web development and is primarily client-side?
questions.explanation: JavaScript is widely used for client-side web development, enabling interactive elements on websites.

questions.text: What is the binary equivalent of the decimal number 10?
questions.explanation: The decimal number 10 is represented as 1010 in binary, calculated by dividing by 2 and noting remainders.

questions.text: Which component connects a computer to a network?
questions.explanation: A Network Interface Card (NIC) enables a computer to connect to a network, wired or wireless.

questions.text: What is the purpose of an operating system?
questions.explanation: An operating system manages hardware, software, and provides services for computer programs.

questions.text: Which of these is a loop structure in programming?
questions.explanation: A 'for' loop is used to repeat a block of code a specified number of times in programming.

questions.text: What does SSD stand for in storage technology?
questions.explanation: SSD (Solid State Drive) uses flash memory for faster data storage and retrieval compared to traditional hard drives.

questions.text: Which protocol is used for secure web browsing?
questions.explanation: HTTPS (HyperText Transfer Protocol Secure) encrypts data for secure web communication.

questions.text: What is the purpose of a firewall?
questions.explanation: A firewall monitors and controls network traffic to protect systems from unauthorized access.

questions.text: Which of these is a relational database management system?
questions.explanation: MySQL is a relational database management system that organizes data into tables with relationships.

questions.text: What is the hexadecimal equivalent of the binary number 1111?
questions.explanation: The binary number 1111 equals 15 in decimal, which is represented as F in hexadecimal.

questions.text: Which of the following is an example of an input device?
questions.explanation: A keyboard is an input device that allows users to enter data into a computer.

questions.text: What does GUI stand for?
questions.explanation: GUI (Graphical User Interface) allows users to interact with devices through visual elements like icons and windows.

questions.text: Which data structure follows the Last In, First Out (LIFO) principle?
questions.explanation: A stack follows the LIFO principle, where the last element added is the first to be removed.

questions.text: What is the purpose of a compiler?

options.text: Translate source code to machine code

questions.explanation: A compiler translates high-level source code into machine code that a computer can execute.

questions.text: Which of these is a markup language?
questions.explanation: HTML (HyperText Markup Language) is used to structure content on the web, unlike programming languages.

questions.text: What does IP stand for in networking?
questions.explanation: IP (Internet Protocol) is a set of rules for addressing and routing data packets across networks.

questions.text: Which of these is a type of software testing?
questions.explanation: Unit Testing involves testing individual components of software to ensure they work correctly.

questions.text: What is the function of a router in a network?
questions.explanation: A router directs data packets between networks, connecting devices to the internet or other networks.

questions.text: Which of these is a cloud computing service model?
questions.explanation: SaaS (Software as a Service) is a cloud computing model where software is provided over the internet.

questions.text: What is the purpose of a variable in programming?
questions.explanation: Variables store data values that can be used and modified during program execution.

questions.text: Which of these is an example of an output device?
questions.explanation: A monitor is an output device that displays information visually to the user.

questions.text: What does DNS stand for?
questions.explanation: DNS (Domain Name System) translates domain names into IP addresses for network communication.

questions.text: Which of these is a logic gate?
questions.explanation: AND is a logic gate that outputs true only if all inputs are true, used in digital circuits.

questions.text: What is the main function of a GPU?
questions.explanation: A GPU (Graphics Processing Unit) is specialized for rendering images, videos, and animations.

questions.text: Which of these is a version control system?
questions.explanation: Git is a version control system used to track changes in source code during software development.

questions.text: What is the purpose of a primary key in a database?
questions.explanation: A primary key uniquely identifies each record in a database table, ensuring data integrity.

questions.text: Which of these is a type of cyber attack?
questions.explanation: Phishing is a cyber attack where attackers trick users into revealing sensitive information.

questions.text: What is the purpose of an algorithm?
questions.explanation: An algorithm is a set of steps designed to solve a problem or perform a task efficiently.

questions.text: Which of these is a non-volatile storage device?
questions.explanation: An SSD (Solid State Drive) retains data without power, making it non-volatile.

questions.text: What does API stand for?
questions.explanation: An API (Application Programming Interface) allows different software applications to communicate.

questions.text: Which of these is a sorting algorithm?
questions.explanation: Bubble Sort is an algorithm that sorts data by repeatedly comparing and swapping adjacent elements.

questions.text: What is the purpose of a modem?

options.text: Convert digital signals to analog and vice versa

questions.explanation: A modem converts digital signals to analog and vice versa to connect networks to the internet.

questions.text: Which of these is an object-oriented programming language?
questions.explanation: Java is an object-oriented programming language that uses objects and classes for modularity.

questions.text: What is the purpose of a cache memory?
questions.explanation: Cache memory stores frequently accessed data to speed up processing by reducing access time.

questions.text: Which of these is a wireless networking standard?
questions.explanation: Wi-Fi is a wireless networking standard that allows devices to connect to the internet without cables.

questions.text: What does SQL stand for?
questions.explanation: SQL (Structured Query Language) is used to manage and query data in relational databases.

questions.text: Which of these is a benefit of virtualization?
questions.explanation: Virtualization allows multiple virtual machines to run on a single physical machine, improving resource utilization.
